features.name: Inquisitor Proficiencies
features.desc: An inquisitor is proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, plus the longbow, shortbow, and the favored weapon of her deity. She is also proficient with light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).

features.name: Orisons
features.desc: Inquisitors can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}orisons{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.

features.name: Stern Gaze
features.desc: Inquisitors are skilled at sensing deception and intimidating their foes. An inquisitor receives a morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made for intimidation and {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g} equal to 1/2 her inquisitor level (minimum +1).

features.name: Domain Selection
features.desc:
A divine caster's deity influences their {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, what magic they can perform, their values, and how others see them. The character chooses domains (in quantity depending on their class) from among those belonging to their deity. A character can select an alignment domain (Chaos, Evil, Good, or Law) only if their own alignment matches that domain.
Each domain grants a number of domain powers, dependent upon the level of the divine caster.
Clerics also gain a number of bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. A cleric gains one domain spell slot for each level of cleric spell they can cast, from 1st on up. Each day, a cleric can prepare one of the spells from their two domains in that slot. If a domain spell is not on the cleric spell list, a cleric can prepare it only in a domain spell slot. Domain spells cannot be used to cast spells spontaneously.

features.name: Judgment
features.desc:
Starting at 1st level, an inquisitor can pronounce judgment upon her foes as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. Starting when the judgment is made, the inquisitor receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g} based on the type of judgment made.
At 1st level, an inquisitor can use this ability once per day. At 4th level and every three levels thereafter, the inquisitor can use this ability one additional time per day. Once activated, this ability lasts until the combat ends, at which point all of the bonuses immediately end.
When the inquisitor uses this ability, she must select one type of judgment to make. As a swift {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, she can change this judgment to another type.

features.name: Cunning Initiative
features.desc: At 2nd level, an inquisitor adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, in addition to her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier.

features.name: Solo Tactics
features.desc: At 3rd level, all of the inquisitor's allies are treated as if they possessed the same teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} as the inquisitor for the purpose of determining whether the inquisitor receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} from her teamwork feats. Her allies do not receive any bonuses from these feats unless they actually possess the feats themselves. The allies' positioning and {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} must still meet the prerequisites listed in the teamwork feat for the inquisitor to receive the listed bonus.

features.name: Teamwork Feat
features.desc: At 3rd level, and every three levels thereafter, the inquisitor gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} in addition to those gained from normal advancement. These bonus feats must be selected from those listed as teamwork feats. The inquisitor must meet the prerequisites of the selected bonus feat.

features.name: Judgment
features.desc:
Starting at 1st level, an inquisitor can pronounce judgment upon her foes as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. Starting when the judgment is made, the inquisitor receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g} based on the type of judgment made.
At 1st level, an inquisitor can use this ability once per day. At 4th level and every three levels thereafter, the inquisitor can use this ability one additional time per day. Once activated, this ability lasts until the combat ends, at which point all of the bonuses immediately end.
When the inquisitor uses this ability, she must select one type of judgment to make. As a swift {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, she can change this judgment to another type.

features.name: Bane
features.desc:
At 5th level, an inquisitor can imbue one of her weapons with the bane weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
A bane weapon excels against certain foes. Against a designated foe, the weapon's enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} is +2 better than its actual bonus. It also deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against such foes.
This ability only functions while the inquisitor wields the weapon. If dropped or taken, the weapon resumes granting this ability if it is returned to the inquisitor before the duration expires.
This ability lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to the inquisitor's level. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.

features.name: Second Judgment
features.desc: At 8th level, whenever an inquisitor uses her judgment ability, she selects two different judgments, instead of one. This only consumes one use of her judgment ability. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, she can change one of these judgments to another type.

features.name: Stalwart
features.desc: At 11th level, an inquisitor can use mental and physical resiliency to avoid certain {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. If she makes a Fortitude or {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} against an attack that has a halved {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful save, she instead avoids the damage entirely. This ability can only be used if the inquisitor is wearing light armor, medium armor, or no armor.

features.name: Greater Bane
features.desc: At 12th level, whenever an inquisitor uses her bane ability, the amount of bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt by the weapon against creatures of the selected type increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g}.

features.name: Exploit Weakness
features.desc: At 14th level, the inquisitor learns to take advantage of any opportunity that presents itself. Whenever the inquisitor scores a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, she ignores any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} the target might have. In addition, if the target has {g|Encyclopedia:Regeneration}regeneration{/g}, the creature loses regeneration on the {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} following the critical hit and can die normally during that round. Creatures whose regeneration always functions are immune to this ability.

features.name: Third Judgment
features.desc: At 16th level, whenever an inquisitor uses her judgment ability, she selects three different judgments, instead of just two. This only consumes one use of her judgment ability. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the inquisitor can change one of these judgments to another type.

features.name: True Judgment
features.desc: At 20th level, an inquisitor can call true judgment down upon a foe during combat. Whenever an inquisitor uses her judgment ability, the inquisitor can invoke true judgment on a foe as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. Once declared, the inquisitor can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. If the attack hits, it deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and the target must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the inquisitor's level + the inquisitor's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. Regardless of whether or not the save is made, the target creature is immune to the inquisitor's true judgment ability for 24 hours.

features.name: Sworn Enemy
features.desc: A faith hunter chooses a single {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} that opposes her own along either the law/chaos axis or the good/evil axis. Creatures of this alignment are her sworn enemies.

features.name: Judgment
features.desc:
Starting at 1st level, an inquisitor can pronounce judgment upon her foes as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. Starting when the judgment is made, the inquisitor receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g} based on the type of judgment made.
At 1st level, an inquisitor can use this ability once per day. At 4th level and every three levels thereafter, the inquisitor can use this ability one additional time per day. Once activated, this ability lasts until the combat ends, at which point all of the bonuses immediately end.
When the inquisitor uses this ability, she must select one type of judgment to make. As a swift {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, she can change this judgment to another type.

features.name: Sworn Enemy — Smite
features.desc:
At 6th level, once per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a faith hunter can smite one foe she can see. If the foe is of the faith hunter's sworn enemy {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, the faith hunter gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} against that foe and a bonus equal to half her inquisitor level on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the foe. Smites against targets of the faith hunter's sworn enemy alignment automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the creature might possess. If the faith hunter targets a creature that is not of her sworn enemy alignment, the smite is wasted with no effect.
The smite effect remains until the foe is dead or the next time the faith hunter rests and regains her uses of this ability. At 10th level and every 4 inquisitor levels thereafter, a faith hunter can smite her enemies one additional time per day, to a maximum of four times per day at 18th level.

features.name: Sworn Enemy — Smite
features.desc:
At 6th level, once per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a faith hunter can smite one foe she can see. If the foe is of the faith hunter's sworn enemy {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, the faith hunter gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} against that foe and a bonus equal to half her inquisitor level on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the foe. Smites against targets of the faith hunter's sworn enemy alignment automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the creature might possess. If the faith hunter targets a creature that is not of her sworn enemy alignment, the smite is wasted with no effect.
The smite effect remains until the foe is dead or the next time the faith hunter rests and regains her uses of this ability. At 10th level and every 4 inquisitor levels thereafter, a faith hunter can smite her enemies one additional time per day, to a maximum of four times per day at 18th level.

features.name: Summon Monster
features.desc: Starting at 1st level, a monster tactician can cast summon monster I as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} a number of times per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. She can cast this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, and the creatures remain for 1 minute per level (instead of 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per level). At 3rd level and every 2 inquisitor levels thereafter, the power of this ability increases by 1 spell level, allowing her to summon more powerful creatures (to a maximum of summon monster IX at 17th level). A monster tactician cannot have more than one summon monster spell active in this way at a time; if she uses another, any existing summon monster immediately ends.

features.name: Summon Monster I
features.desc: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons an extraplanar dog. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.

features.name: Summon Monster II
features.desc: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons an extraplanar wolf or {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar dogs. The summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.

features.name: Summon Monster III
features.desc: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons an extraplanar monitor lizard, {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar wolves, or 1d4+1 extraplanar dogs. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.

features.name: Summon Monster IV
features.desc: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons an extraplanar dire wolf, {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar monitor lizards, or 1d4+1 extraplanar wolves. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.

features.name: Summon Monster V
features.desc: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar dire wolves, 1d4+1 extraplanar monitor lizards, or one extraplanar redcap if you are evil or one extraplanar bralani azata if you are not. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.

features.name: Summon Monster VI
features.desc: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar redcaps if you are evil or 1d3 extraplanar bralani azatas if you are not, 1d4+1 extraplanar dire wolves, or one extraplanar soul eater if you are evil or one extraplanar axiomite if you are not. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.

features.name: Summon Monster VII
features.desc: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar soul eaters if you are evil and 1d3 extraplanar axiomites if you are not, 1d4+1 extraplanar redcaps if you are evil and 1d4+1 extraplanar bralani azatas if you are not, or one bogeyman. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.

features.name: Summon Monster VIII
features.desc: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar bogeymen, 1d4+1 extraplanar soul eaters if you are evil and 1d4+1 extraplanar axiomites if you are not, or one frost giant if you are evil and one movanic deva if you are not. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.

features.name: Summon Monster IX
features.desc: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar frost giants if you are evil and 1d3 extraplanar movanic devas if you are not, 1d4+1 bogeymen, or one thanadaemon if you are evil and one ghaele azata if you are not. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.

features.name: Summon Tactics
features.desc: At 5th level, every time a monster tactician casts a summoning {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, all creatures summoned by the spell are treated as if they knew all of the monster tactician's teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}.

features.name: Leader's Words
features.desc: Tactical leaders are skilled at speaking soothing words that keep the peace and bolster allies' resolve. A tactical leader receives a morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} (when used for diplomacy) equal to half his inquisitor level (minimum +1).

features.name: Swift Tactician
features.desc:
At 3rd level, 9th level, and 18th level, a tactical leader gains a teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat. He must meet the prerequisites for this feat. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the tactical leader can grant these feats to all allies within 30 feet who can see and hear him. Allies retain the use of these bonus feats for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} plus 1 round for every 2 inquisitor levels the tactical leader has. Allies do not need to meet the prerequisites of these bonus feats.
The tactical leader can use this ability once per day at 3rd level, plus one additional time per day at 6th, 9th, 15th, and 18th level.
At 12th level, a tactical leader can use the tactician ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.

features.name: Swift Tactician
features.desc: At 12th level, a tactical leader can use the tactician ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.

features.name: Battle Acumen
features.desc: At 14th level, a tactical leader can grant his judgment benefits to a single other ally within 30 feet who can see and hear the tactical leader as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. These benefits last for 1 minute. A tactical leader can use this ability a number of times per day equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier (minimum 1).

features.name: Animal Companion
features.desc: Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the druid advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective druid levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their druid reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.

features.name: Hunter Tactics
features.desc: At 3rd level, a sacred huntsmaster automatically grants her teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} to her animal companion. The companion doesn't need to meet the prerequisites of these teamwork feats.

features.name: Favored Enemy
features.desc:
At 1st level, a ranger selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and every five levels thereafter (10th, 15th, and 20th level), the ranger may select an additional favored enemy. In addition, at each such interval, the bonus against any one favored enemy (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.
If the ranger chooses humanoids or outsiders as a favored enemy, he must also choose an associated subtype, as indicated on the table below. If a specific creature falls into more than one category of favored enemy, the ranger's bonuses do not stack; he simply uses whichever bonus is higher.

features.name: Favored Enemy
features.desc:
At 1st level, a ranger selects a creature type from the ranger favored enemies list. He gets a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against them.
At 5th level and every five levels thereafter (10th, 15th, and 20th level), the ranger may select an additional favored enemy. In addition, at each such interval, the bonus against any one favored enemy (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.
If the ranger chooses humanoids or outsiders as a favored enemy, he must also choose an associated subtype, as indicated on the table below. If a specific creature falls into more than one category of favored enemy, the ranger's bonuses do not stack; he simply uses whichever bonus is higher.

features.name: Studied Target
features.desc: At 1st level, a sanctified slayer gains the slayer's studied target class feature. She uses her inquisitor level as her effective slayer level to determine the effects of studied target.

features.name: Sneak Attack
features.desc:
If a character can catch an opponent when he is unable to defend himself effectively from her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, she can strike a vital spot for extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
The character's attack deals extra damage anytime her target would be denied a {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (whether the target actually has a Dexterity bonus or not), or when the character {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanks{/g} her target. This extra damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} and increases by 1d6 at later levels. This additional damage is precision damage and is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
The character must be able to see the target well enough to pick out a vital spot and must be able to {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} such a spot.

features.name: Talented Slayer
features.desc: At 8th, 16th, 17th, and 20th levels, a sanctified slayer can gain a single slayer talent, including those from the list of rogue talents that a slayer can take, but not an advanced slayer talent.

features.name: Slayer Talents
features.desc:
As a slayer gains {g|Encyclopedia:XP}experience{/g}, he learns a number of talents that aid him and confound his foes. Starting at 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a slayer gains one slayer talent.
Slayer can take rogue talents as slayer talents, counting his slayer level as rogue level.
After 2nd level, the slayer can select a ranger combat style (such as archery or two-weapon combat) and gains a combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} from the first feat list of that style. He can choose feats from his selected combat style, even if he does not have the normal prerequisites. After 6th level, he may select this talent again and add the 6th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list. After 10th level, he may select this talent again and add the 10th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list.

features.name: Slayer Talents
features.desc:
As a slayer gains {g|Encyclopedia:XP}experience{/g}, he learns a number of talents that aid him and confound his foes. Starting at 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a slayer gains one slayer talent.
Slayer can take rogue talents as slayer talents, counting his slayer level as rogue level.
After 2nd level, the slayer can select a ranger combat style (such as archery or two-weapon combat) and gains a combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} from the first feat list of that style. He can choose feats from his selected combat style, even if he does not have the normal prerequisites. After 6th level, he may select this talent again and add the 6th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list. After 10th level, he may select this talent again and add the 10th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list.

features.name: Judgement Aura
features.desc: At 3rd level, Judge gains the ability to share his judgements with all allies in a 30-foot radius. He can use this ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} once plus one time for every six levels thereafter. The {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} work until the end of combat.

features.name: Sentence
features.desc: At 5th level, Judge gains the ability to sentence a target. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, until the end of combat all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} against the target made by your allies deal additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to one per three inquisitor levels. You can use this ability once, plus one time for every 5 levels thereafter.

features.name: Greater Sentence
features.desc: At 12th level, your Sentence ability also make all your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} ignore Sentence target's {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}.
